page.title: 14SWANSEA DOCKS (contd)
page.content: Llandarcy in 1918. In 1920 the Queen's Dock was opened to handle this trade and in the 1950's oil imports and exports through the Dock totalled 8m tons per annum. The Queen's Dock today also handles the Port's extensive petro_chemical traffic. The Port also acts as a supply base for the off_shore oil rigs in the Celtic Sea and has dealt with a number of oil drilling vessels and supply ships in connection with exploration to date. Because of its inability to take large tankers, the import of crude oil into Swansea has declined. Today most of Llandarcy's crude comes via pipeline from Milford Haven. The Queen's Dock still handes exports from Baglan Bay Petro_Chemical Works. Other commodities passing through the port include aluminium, dredged sand,quartzstone and manganese ore.
